notesStmt.note: Paragraphs divided by a punctus plus five spaces; A fragment from R. Sa'adia Gaon's First baḳashah as found in Kitab gamiʹ altsalaṿat ṿaʹaltasabih, that starts אתה הוא י'י לבדיך (Davidson, Thesaurus of Medieval Hebrew poetry. New York : JTS, 1924, 8755א) with intermittent Arabic translation. The Arabic version here differs greatly from the one found in the published edition (Sidur Rav Seʹadyah Gaʾon / Israel Davision [ed.]. Jersualem : Meḳitse nirdamim, 1963, pp. 47-63). The fragment starts in the Arabic translation, parallel to, in the published edition, p. 54 l. 4 'p. 55 l. 2, where the copy reverts to the Hebrew, ibid. ll. 2-14, followed by its parallel Arabic version, and then continues with the Hebrew p. 55 l. 15, the fragment ends at p. 56 l. 2.
Condition: consecutive (Halper: forming outer sheet of a fasc.); damaged, torn, losses in upper exterior edge.
